title: Phrasal Verbs With Come And Cut

exercises.title: Phrasal Verbs With Come And Cut

questions.question: Pull hard and the two pieces will come …………………..
questions.description: When things come apart, they separate.

questions.question: I came ………………. an old friend of mine yesterday.
questions.description: To come across somebody is to meet them unexpectedly.

questions.question: I came ………………. with typhoid last month.
questions.description: To come down with typhoid is to become sick with typhoid.

questions.question: The watchman came …………….. with all the evidences he could collect.
questions.description: To come forward is to volunteer for a task.

questions.question: If you want to lose weight, you should cut ……………… cheese and burgers.
questions.description: To cut back on something is to consume less of it.

questions.question: We had to cut many trees …………….. to build the house.
questions.description: To cut something down is to make it fall to the ground.

questions.question: Julie cut …………… while I was chatting with her friend.
questions.description: To cut in is to interrupt.

questions.question: The air conditioner will cut ……………… when the room temperature reaches 26 degree Celsius.
questions.description: When a machine or engine cuts in, it starts operating.

questions.question: The doctors cut ……………….. his legs to save his life.
The utility company cut ……………… our power supply because we hadn’t paid the bill.
questions.description: To cut off power is to stop providing it.

questions.question: His parents cut him ………….. when he married against their wishes.
questions.description: To cut somebody off is to take them out of a will.

questions.question: I cut these pictures ………………. of a magazine.
questions.description: To cut something out is to remove it with scissors.
